alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Prince George; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 10:22PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with locally heavy downpours will impact portions of Chesterfield, Mecklenburg, Lunenburg, Nottoway, northwestern Prince George, Dinwiddie, southeastern Amelia and northern Brunswick Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 1100 PM EDT... At 1020 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms from near Chesterfield Court House to near Turbeville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Rain up to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding on roadways in low lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, South Hill, Blackstone, Chase City, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, McKenney, Moseley, Chester, Mannboro, Fort Lee, Virginia State University, Prince George, Nottoway, Lunenburg and Clarksville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Prince George; Western Chesterfield
